name: Thai-style chicken rolls
recipeIngredient: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves (about 110 g each),
2 tsp Asian chili paste, such as sambal oelek,
Salt and freshly ground black pepper,
1/4 red pepper (cut into long thin strips),
1/4 yellow pepper (cut into long thin strips),
1 tbsp vegetable oil, like soy or groundnut,
1/2 tsp asian chili paste, such as sambal oelek,
1 tbsp chopped fresh mint or coriander.
recipeInstructions: 1) Pound each chicken breast between cling film into a 10 by 10 cm by 0.3cm thick.
2) Lay a piece of chicken smooth-side down on the work surface.
3) Spread 1/2 teaspoon of the chilli paste over the surface and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
4) Trim and halve the spring onions lengthwise. Lay them side-by-side across the lower third of the chicken, so there is white and greens at both ends.
5) Top with 2 or 3 pieces of the red and yellow peppers.
6) Roll the chicken around the vegetables into a tight cylinder and thread a wooden skewer through the seam of the roll to seal.
7) Repeat with the remaining chicken and vegetables to make 4 rolls. These can be made up to 24 hours ahead and refrigerated.
9) Heat the oil in an ovenproof non-stick pan over high heat. Season the rolls with salt and
pepper, to taste. Lay the rolls, seam side down, in the pan, and cook, turning occasionally, until browned, about 2 minutes.
10) Transfer the pan to the oven, and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes more.
1) Carefully remove the skewers, taking care to keep the rolls intact. Cut across the rolls to make round pieces about 2 cm thick, and thread onto skewers.
2) Transfer to a platter, sprinkle with peanuts and serve with the dipping sauce.
1) Combine the lime juice, fish sauce, water, chili paste, honey, mint and coriander in a small bowl and set aside.
